Name: Jessica Flores
Motivations / Fears: Wants a fair future for her kid; fears community division
Initial Reaction: Honestly, this felt like a breath of fresh air. It didn’t read like political mudslinging, more like someone who grew up here and actually gets the work families do.
Rationale: I spend my days around students whose families are scraping by. When someone speaks from a place of direct experience instead of manufactured outrage, it resonates.
Agreement/Disagreement: ✅ Agree – Respect for ranchers’ work\n✅ Agree – Emphasis on fact-based policy\n❌ Disagree – Opening reference to national politics might turn off centrists
Trust & Authenticity: Comes across trustworthy — grounded, professional, not performative.
Suggested Improvement: Lead with local values before referencing national figures.
Persona Summary: I'd tell a colleague: “She clearly knows this space. Grounded, smart, not emotional theater.”
Tags: authenticity, grounded, educator tone, rural realism

Name: Ryan Delgado
Media Consumption: YouTube explainers, Reddit threads, local IG pages
Motivations / Fears: Wants stable housing; fears climate worsening
Quote / Expression: “Why aren’t we fixing the basics first?”
Initial Reaction: My first thought was: finally a political post that isn’t yelling. Felt thoughtful and connected to place.
Rationale: Working with local nonprofits, I see how messaging matters. This one hit that sweet spot of personal story + facts.
Agreement/Disagreement: ✅ Agree – Local roots emphasized\n❌ Disagree – A little too policy-heavy for casual readers
Trust & Authenticity: Tone felt real. Not preachy, not corporate.
Suggested Improvement: Shorten the intro; put the relatable part earlier.
Persona Summary: I’d say: “Solid message — just trim the fat.”

Name: Elaine Porter
Motivations / Fears: Wants seniors protected; fears loss of services
Quote / Expression: “We’re only as good as how we treat people.”
Initial Reaction: I appreciated this a lot. It wasn’t angry or condescending — it felt steady and informed.
Rationale: After decades in social work, I can feel sincerity a mile away. This hit that tone.
Agreement/Disagreement: ✅ Agree – Respectful tone\n❌ Disagree – Might be too long for busy readers
Suggested Improvement: Bring key point to the top sooner.
Persona Summary: I’d tell a friend: “This is the tone we need more of — respectful and informed.”
